text: Solly Ward (October 11, 1890 – May 17, 1942) was an American actor and comedian. He appeared in the films Flight from Glory, Living on Love, Danger Patrol, She's Got Everything, Everybody's Doing It, Maid's Night Out, This Marriage Business, Blind Alibi, Smashing the Rackets, Conspiracy, Sued for Libel and Footlight Fever. He died on May 17, 1942, in Hollywood, Los Angeles, California at age 51. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1890 births Category:1942 deaths Category:20th-century American male actors Category:American male film actors
title: Solly Ward
